author: nanook
title: NFL free agency: Best players available at each position
summary: Many of the top players in 2018 NFL free agency have been signed, but plenty elite talents remain available. Here are the best players left on the free agency market at each position.

author: nanook
title: Earl Thomas to Cowboys leads list of five trades NFL teams could make in second wave of free agency
summary: The NFL has been awash in trades this offseason. It's unlike anything we have seen in this league before, largely due in part to factors stemming from the latest Collective Bargaining Agreement and the rising salary cap. The former wiped out a large chunk of the middle-class veterans around the NFL while also making cheap rookie contracts the preferred method of roster construction.  Abundant salary cap space for virtually every NFL teams means no need to simply cut high-priced, average starters. As an example, consider Robert Quinn, traded from the Rams to the Dolphins this offseason. Five years ago, Quinn is cut, no question, as Los Angeles tries to save $10 million in cap space. No one's would

author: captainunderoos
title: NFL Mock Draft 2018: Bills, Jaguars land right QBs; 49ers start own 'LOB'
summary: Our latest NFL Mock Draft for 2018 features the most ideal landing places for five QBs in the first round. Plus, Denver and San Francisco land luxury skill players in the top 10.

author: captainunderoos
title: Cowboys sign Deonte Thompson
summary: The Cowboys spent time with a few receivers this week and they signed one of them on Thursday. Agent David Canter announced that his client Deonte Thompson has agreed to a deal with Dallas. He joins linebacker Joe Thomas additions to the Cowboys roster this week. Thompson joined the Bills after playing five games for [more]

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: John Lynch Says Kyle Shanahan's "Master Plan" Was Getting Kirk Cousins To The 49ers
summary: San Francisco 49ers GM John Lynch went on ESPN Radio's Mike & Trey Wednesday to talk about his team's big offseason and Jimmy Garoppolo's exciting future. Getting Garoppolo for a second-round pick from the Patriots last year was huge, since the quarterback looked outstanding as he led the 49ers to five straight wins to end the season, but Lynch revealed the team's coach originally wanted a different signal caller. Kirk Cousins was long connected to the once-vacant Niners QB gig, which made sense since head coach Kyle Shanahan previously served as Cousins's offensive coordinator in Washington. There was supposedly mutual interest before the Garoppolo trade. Shanahan didn't get his guy, but Lynch

title: Phivida Signs Exclusive Partnership with Athletes for Care, Inc.

author: nanook
title: Eagles WR Mack Hollins poised to make a leap in Year 2
summary: Let's get to the Philadelphia Eagles links ... Advanced stats suggest Philadelphia Eagles' Mack Hollins could be an upgrade over Torrey Smith - PennLive That's not to diminish Smith's value as a leader or declare Hollins a sure-fire star. And these stats can be deceiving. But consider this: Football Outsiders uses a formula it calls DVOA (defense-adjusted value over average) to measure a players' per-snap value compared to the average performer at his position, and Hollins finished with a plus-24.8 percent DVOA in 2017. Smith, meanwhile, finished with a mark of minus-15.7. Another way to look at this is through Football Outsiders' DYAR (defense-adjusted yards above replacement), which measures

author: captainunderoos
title: Deshaun Watson says one QB in the 2018 NFL Draft could 'surprise' a lot of people
summary: If the past few weeks are any indication, there's a good chance the NFL Draft is going to get crazy next month, and that's because everyone wants a quarterback.  In the past 10 days alone, we've seen the Jets and Bills both make big trades to move up, so who knows how wild things might get on draft night.  Of course, even if you move up in the draft, there's no guarantee you're going to select the right person. With six quarterbacks possibly being selected in the first round, history says that most of them are probably going to fizzle out. As a matter of fact, the last time there were just five quarterbacks taken in the first round, that didn't really work out well for anyone except the Eagles,

author: nanook
title: New Lions DT Sylvester Williams excited 'to build something' in Detroit
summary: Dave Birkett discusses the Detroit Lions' decision to release tight end Eric Ebron on Wednesday, March 14, 2018. The Denver Broncos had one of the best run defenses in the NFL with Sylvester Williams starting at nose tackle three seasons ago. Now, the Detroit Lions are hoping Williams can have a similar impact on their defense. The Lions signed Williams to a one-year contract on Wednesday, adding a 313-pound run-stuffing presence to the middle of their defensive line. “I think one of things that I'm looking forward to bringing to the game is just my ability to play the run and be stout in the middle,” Williams said in a conference call with Detroit reporters. “I'm looking forward to that, I'm

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: 5 bold predictions about this season
summary: From the FanPosts -Joel First and foremost, a big shoutout to Enite for posting his 5 bold predictions for the Chiefs for the upcoming season. This post is obviously inspired by that, so definitely check that out as well. I want to focus on non-Chiefs predictions here. I will cheat my post title a bit by doing 5 in the AFC West and 5 for the rest of the NFL. You can follow suit in the comments if you wish. AFC West 5 Bold Predictions: 1) The Raiders finish the 2018 season with a record of 3-13 and pick 3rd in the 2019 NFL Draft There is a lot of optimism with the Raiders now between their relocation to Vegas and bringing in Gruden. However, the fact remains that this is an older and not-very-talented

author: captainunderoos
title: Lions sign Williams, fill void left by Ngata exit
summary: Michael Rothstein ESPN Staff Writer Close Previously covered University of Michigan for ESPN.com and AnnArbor.com Also covered Notre Dame for Fort Wayne Journal Gazette Follow on Twitter The Detroit Lions filled one of their biggest needs by signing defensive tackle Sylvester Williams to a one-year deal, it was announced Wednesday. The 29-year-old Williams, who helps the Lions replace Haloti Ngata, likely would slide into a starting role and be in an interior line rotation with A'Shawn Robinson and Akeem Spence, who both started at defensive tackle after Ngata was lost for the season. With Ngata out of the lineup, Detroit's run defense suffered. Ngata signed with the Philadelphia Eagles last

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: The NFL reveals specifics of its new proposed catch rule

author: nanook
title: Should the Eagles pursue free agent WR Allen Hurns?
summary: The Eagles will likely add to their wide receiver position before training camp. But it's unclear if they'll chose to target a pass catcher in free agency, the draft — or both. A talented receiver hit the open market on Tuesday when the Jaguars released Allen Hurns. Should the Eagles consider signing the 26-year-old wideout? Hurns will have a market for his services. He reportedly already has a meeting with the Cowboys on Wednesday and the Jets are trying to schedule one as well. He's young and he's shown he can produce at a high level when healthy. His best season came in 2015 when he caught 64 passes for 1,031 yards and 10 touchdowns. Hurns will probably come with a hefty price tag. But he1

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: The NFL moving forward with the Jesse James rule for catches
summary: It might be shocking but it appears the NFL is prepared to make a significant change to the catch rule. The Pittsburgh Steelers were on the wrong end of the convoluted catch rule last season but it looks like that might have been the tipping point for real change. Washington Post writer Mark Maske sent out a series of tweets explaining the concept of “surviving the ground” is going away. It appears the NFL is making the rule slightly less ambiguous to favor effort by the receiver. Last season, when Steelers' tight end Jesse James lunged across the goal line for what would have been the game-winning touchdown over the New England Patriots, officials said it didn't survive the ground. It isn't

author: third_watch
title: With original-round tender, Rams should try to poach Cameron Meredith from Bears
summary: The wide receiver market dried up incredibly fast in free agency with guys like Allen Robinson, Sammy Watkins and Marqise Lee flying off the board. Add in Jarvis Landry receiving the franchise tag and there was hardly a chance for the Los Angeles Rams to sign Watkins or any of the top targets. A week into free agency, there aren't many options left. Terrelle Pryor is probably the top guy out there with Allen Hurns close behind, but only the former fits well with the Rams. One player very few people are talking about is Bears receiver Cameron Meredith. He missed the entire 2017 season due to a torn ACL suffered in the preseason, preventing him from building upon a breakout 2016 campaign. That

author: DeltaBravo
title: Former players charge NFL with obstructing billion-dollar concussion settlement
summary: A recent court filing accused the NFL of trying to game the system in order to avoid paying medical benefits.

author: nanook
title: Anthony Hitchens signing among 'worst free agency deals' per NFL analyst
summary: Most Chiefs fans are happy about the team's big free agency splashes which included signing receiver Sammy Watkins and linebacker Anthony Hitchens. Both were signed to massive deals which is the price teams pay to get good players in free agency. Still, some analysts believe the Chiefs overpaid for their big free agent signings. Around the NFL editor Gregg Rosenthal didn't like the Chiefs giving Hitchens a five-year, $45 million deal. He considered it to be among the “worst free agency deals” this offseason: “It's rare to see any inside linebacker get a $14 million signing bonus and $21.5 million fully guaranteed over the first two years of a contract, much less one who has never come close to

author: nanook
title: Richard Sherman expresses “concern” Eric Reid remains unsigned
summary: Eric Reid has not found any takers on the free agent market, and he believes he knows why. New 49ers cornerback Richard Sherman, who served as the Seahawks’ player representative, expressed concern about Reid’s slow market. “We are concerned, because he played at a high level for just about every year that he’s played in [more]

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Purple Pride likely to be Purple Prime (Time) for Minnesota Vikings in 2018
summary: Rumors about the NFL's 2018 schedule have already started to leak. For the Minnesota Vikings, the first piece of their schedule puzzle has already been determined with the season opener – an NFC Championship Game rematch with the Philadelphia Eagles, according to a Philadelphia radio station. It will be a high-intensity game with a lot on the line for a Week 1 matchup. If you don't think a Week 1 game can be vital, just look at the Vikings and Saints from Week 1 last season. The difference between winning and losing that game would have entailed the Vikings not getting a bye, having to play on wild card weekend and, if they had played New Orleans, it would have been in the Superdome, not U.S.

author: captainunderoos
title: Patriots Free Agency: Re-Ranking New England's Needs After Flurry Of Additions
summary: The New England Patriots certainly haven't been as busy this spring as they were last year, but they have been able to address several of their biggest needs through trades and free agency. Since the NFL league year opened last Wednesday, the Patriots have signed a defensive end (Adrian Clayborn), a running back (Jeremy Hill) and an offensive tackle (Matt Tobin) and traded for a cornerback (Jason McCourty), a defensive tackle (Danny Shelton) and a wide receiver (Cordarrelle Patterson). They've also re-signed running back Rex Burkhead and several special teamers while losing offensive tackle Nate Solder, running back Dion Lewis, cornerback Malcolm Butler and wide receiver Danny Amendola to free

author: third_watch
title: Report: Falcons expressing interest in linebacker Arthur Moats
summary: The Atlanta Falcons have expressed interest in eight-year veteran linebacker Arthur Moats, according to Jeremy Fowler of ESPN.com. Moats has spent matching four-year stints with the Buffalo Bills and Pittsburgh Steelers. While the report states the Steelers remain interested in bringing Moats back possibly later in the free agent process, Moats is exploring his options. [more]

author: third_watch
title: Veteran running backs have been visiting the Chiefs. Why?
summary: Two running backs—Thomas Rawls and Damien Williams—have visited the Kansas City Chiefs over the past week. Here are some links: Free agent RB Thomas Rawls visiting Kansas City Chiefs Dolphins free agent Damien Williams has visits set up with Chiefs and Colts (via Sun Sentinel) Neither signed with the Chiefs, but it led me to ask, what do the Chiefs want with these veteran running backs? Here is how the Chiefs' roster stands at the running back position of this writing: Kareem Hunt Spencer Ware Charcandrick West Akeem Hunt George Atkinson You should probably be familiar with all those names except Atkinson. Atkinson, 25, first entered the league as a 2014 undrafted free agent with the Raiders,

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Saquon Barkley skips Penn State pro day, calls himself best player in the NFL draft
summary: Former Penn State running back Saquon Barkley can't do anything to prevent the rising draft stock of quarterbacks around him.

author: third_watch
title: Stormy Daniels’ Lawyer: Fast Cars, NFL Court Fights and Donald Trump
summary: Taking on Team Trump? No sweat for Michael Avenatti, who races at LeMans and Daytona in his spare time and has faced off against the likes of Roger Goodell and Jerry Jones in high-profile cases against the NFL
